a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share living on less than $3.65 per day vs. share in multidimensional
Multidimensional poverty is defined as being deprived in a range of health, education and living standards indicators.
Source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2022), Alkire, Kanagaratnam and Suppa (2023), The global Multidimensional Poverty Index
Note: Monetary poverty data is measured in international-$ at 2017 prices to account for inflation and differences in the cost of living between
countries. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita.
